title: 1 John Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 John with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 5 chapters.

questions.question: According to 1 John, who is the Word of life that was from the beginning?
questions.explanation: The Word of life refers to Jesus Christ, who was from the beginning and has been heard, seen, and handled.

questions.question: What is said about God in 1 John 1:5?
options: God is light and in Him is no darkness
questions.correctAnswer: God is light and in Him is no darkness
questions.explanation: 1 John 1:5 explicitly declares that God is light and there is no darkness in Him.

questions.question: What happens if we say we have fellowship with God but walk in darkness?
options: We lie and do not practice the truth
questions.correctAnswer: We lie and do not practice the truth
questions.explanation: Walking in darkness while claiming fellowship with God is lying and not practicing the truth.

questions.question: According to 1 John, what cleanses us from all sin?
questions.explanation: The blood of Jesus Christ cleanses us from all sin as stated in 1 John 1:7.

questions.question: What must we do to receive forgiveness and cleansing from unrighteousness?
questions.explanation: Confessing our sins leads to God's faithfulness and justice to forgive and cleanse us.

questions.question: 1 John says if we say we have no sin, what are we doing?
questions.explanation: Claiming no sin is self-deception and the truth is not in us.

questions.question: Who is the advocate with the Father for us when we sin?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ acts as our advocate with the Father when we sin.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:2, Jesus is the propitiation for whose sins?
questions.explanation: Jesus is the propitiation not only for our sins but also for the sins of the whole world.

questions.question: What is the evidence that we know God, according to 1 John 2:3?
questions.explanation: Obedience to God's commandments is the evidence of knowing Him.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:4 say about someone who claims to know God but does not keep His commandments?
options: They are a liar and the truth is not in them
questions.correctAnswer: They are a liar and the truth is not in them
questions.explanation: Claiming to know God without obeying His commandments is lying.

questions.question: What is said about the one who loves his brother in 1 John 2:10?
questions.explanation: Loving one's brother means abiding in the light without occasion of stumbling.

questions.question: Who are described as 'antichrists' in 1 John 2:18?
options: False teachers denying Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: False teachers denying Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: Antichrists are those who deny Jesus is the Christ and have gone out from the church.

questions.question: What unction do believers receive from the Holy One according to 1 John 2:20?
questions.explanation: Believers have an anointing from the Holy One which teaches them all things.

questions.question: What is the new commandment written in 1 John 2:8?
options: Love is true in Him and in you
questions.correctAnswer: Love is true in Him and in you
questions.explanation: The new commandment is true in Jesus and in believers, emphasizing love.

questions.question: Who is said to be born of God in 1 John 3:9?
options: Those who keep the law perfectly
Those who do not commit sin
Those who are of the world
questions.correctAnswer: Those who do not commit sin
questions.explanation: Those born of God do not commit sin because God's seed remains in them.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Son of God being manifested according to 1 John 3:8?
options: To destroy the works of the devil
questions.correctAnswer: To destroy the works of the devil
questions.explanation: The Son of God came to destroy the works of the devil.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:16, how do we perceive the love of God?
options: Because He laid down His life for us
questions.correctAnswer: Because He laid down His life for us
questions.explanation: God’s love is perceived through Jesus laying down His life for us.

questions.question: What does 1 John 3:11 say is the message heard from the beginning?
options: That we should love one another
That we should obey the law
questions.correctAnswer: That we should love one another
questions.explanation: The message from the beginning is that we should love one another.

questions.question: What is said about the one who hateth his brother in 1 John 3:15?
options: He is a murderer and has no eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: He is a murderer and has no eternal life
questions.explanation: Hating a brother is equated to murder and lacking eternal life.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:1 advise believers to do regarding spirits?
options: Try the spirits to see if they are of God
questions.correctAnswer: Try the spirits to see if they are of God
questions.explanation: Believers are instructed to test spirits whether they are from God.

questions.question: How can one know the Spirit of God according to 1 John 4:2?
options: Every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
questions.explanation: Confessing Jesus Christ came in the flesh is a sign of the Spirit of God.

questions.question: What is greater than he that is in the world, according to 1 John 4:4?
questions.explanation: Greater is He that is in the believer than he that is in the world.

questions.question: What is the nature of God as declared in 1 John 4:8?
questions.explanation: God is described simply and profoundly as love.

questions.question: Why did God send His only begotten Son into the world according to 1 John 4:9?
options: That we might live through Him
That we might have political power
questions.correctAnswer: That we might live through Him
questions.explanation: God sent His Son so that through Him we might have life.

questions.question: What kind of love does 1 John 4:10 describe?
options: Love where God loved us first and sent His Son for propitiation
Love shown only to the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: Love where God loved us first and sent His Son for propitiation
questions.explanation: Love is demonstrated by God’s initiative in sending Jesus as propitiation.

questions.question: What is the commandment given from Him in 1 John 4:21?
options: Love God and love your brother also
questions.correctAnswer: Love God and love your brother also
questions.explanation: The commandment is to love God and love one another.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:1, who is born of God?
options: Everyone who believes Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone who believes Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: Belief in Jesus as the Christ results in being born of God.

questions.question: What is the victory that overcomes the world, as stated in 1 John 5:4?
questions.explanation: Faith is described as the victory that overcomes the world.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:5, who is he that overcomes the world?
options: He that believeth Jesus is the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: He that believeth Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: Belief in Jesus as the Son of God enables overcoming the world.

questions.question: What came by water and blood, according to 1 John 5:6?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ came by water and blood, not by water only.

questions.question: How many bear record in heaven according to 1 John 5:7?
questions.explanation: Three bear record in heaven: the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: What three bear witness on earth according to 1 John 5:8?
options: The spirit, the water, and the blood
The angels, the prophets, and the apostles
The law, the prophets, and the psalms
The earth, the sky, and the sea
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit, the water, and the blood
questions.explanation: These three agree in one as witnesses on earth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'If we say that we have no sin, we ______ ourselves, and the truth is not in us.'
questions.explanation: The verse states that claiming no sin is deceiving ourselves.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'God is ______; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.'
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:16 declares 'God is love.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his ______.'
questions.explanation: The Spirit given to believers is proof of dwelling in God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in ______.'
questions.explanation: Confessing Jesus as Son of God means God dwells in that person.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 1:10, if we say we have not sinned, we make God a liar.
questions.explanation: 1 John 1:10 states that denying sin makes God a liar.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2 teaches that if someone loves the world, the love of the Father is in him.
questions.explanation: Loving the world means the love of the Father is not in him (1 John 2:15).

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 3 says that whoever commits sin is of the devil.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:8 states that the one who sins is of the devil.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 4:3, every spirit that denies Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God.
questions.explanation: Denial that Jesus came in the flesh identifies the spirit as not from God.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 4 teaches that there is fear in perfect love.
questions.explanation: Perfect love casts out fear (1 John 4:18).

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 5:11 says that eternal life is in God alone.
questions.explanation: Eternal life is in His Son according to 1 John 5:11.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2:29 says that everyone who does righteousness is born of God.
questions.explanation: Doing righteousness is evidence of being born of God.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 3:19 says that if our heart condemns us, we have confidence toward God.
questions.explanation: If our heart condemns us, God is greater, but confidence is when our heart does not condemn us (1 John 3:19-21).

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 1:7 teaches that walking in the light brings fellowship with one another.
questions.explanation: Walking in the light results in fellowship and cleansing by Jesus' blood.
